INCOME TAX—ALBERTA

Mr. Dechene:

1. What was the total amount of personal income tax collected in the years 1946, 1947, 1948, in the province of Alberta?

2. How much of the above amount was collected from farmers and ranchers in the province of A1- berta during the same years? .

Mr. McCann:

1. Individual income tax collections for the province of Alberta for the ﬁscal years 1946, 1947 and 1948 are as follows:

1946 ...................... $31,861,739 1947 ...................... 35,124,816 1948 ...................... 30,858,199

2. No statistics are available for the amount Jf tax collected from farmers and ranchers in the province of Alberta. Statistics main- tained are only those of taxes declared on ﬁling. The latest available statistics are for the taxation year 1946 when farmers and ranchers in the province of Alberta reported declared taxes of $2,570,000.

ENEMY SHIPS CAPTURED IN WORLD WAR II— PARTICIPATION 0F CANADIAN PERSONNEL

Mr. Fraser:

1. How many enemy ships were captured during world war II, in the capture of which Canadian personnel took part?

2. What was the nationality of each of such ships captured?

3. What was the amount of cargo seized in each case?

4. What disposition has been made to date of all such ships and cargoes?

29087—385

Mr. Baker:

1 and 2. The total number of enemy ships captured in world war II, in the capture of which Canadian personnel took part, is not deﬁnitely known, as Canadian navy and air force personnel serving with United Kingdom units would participate in such actions.

Two enemy ships were captured by H.M.C. ships as follows: S.S. Weser, German mer- chant ship, 9,472 tons gross; S.S. Capo Noli, Italian merchant ship, 4,000 tons gross.

3. SS. Weser, $42,573.48 in value; S.S. Capo Noli, $15,581.79 in value.

4. SS. Weser renamed Vancouver Island under Canadian registry and operated by Canadian government merchant marine until torpedoed and sunk on October 15, 1941. Cargo sold for above amount.

S.S. Capo Noli renamed Bic Island under Canadian registry and operated by Canadian government merchant marine until torpedoed and sunk on October 29, 1942. Cargo sold for above amount.
